title: Dubai expects to witness boom in holiday homes in coming monthsTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Dubai expects to witness boom in holiday homes in coming months Published on : Tuesday, August 25, 2015
With the surge in visitor numbers year after year, the need for a variety of accommodations in Dubai has been strongly felt. To keep up with the high tourist numbers and an eye on the 20 million visitors marks by 2020, Dubai is expected to see a boom in holiday homes in the coming months.
According to data published on a news website quoting an official from the Department of Tourism and Commerce Marketing (Dubai Tourism), the number of registered homes is expected to jump from around 800 as of last month to 1,500 by the end of this year.
Dubai Tourism issued a statement on Monday citing that the Emirate is broadening its range of accommodations through holiday homes, which will help it achieve its target of 20 million visitors per year by 2020.
Khaled Bin Touq, executive director, licensing and classification sector at Dubai Tourism, in an email statement to Gulf News wrote the number of licensed operators of holiday homes in Dubai has reached 37 as of July 2015 which he expects to grow to 100 within the next three years, and to 200 within the next five years.
Gulf News Quote: d Rashid Abu Bakr, associate director at TRI Consulting saying that holiday homes are relatively recent additions to Dubaiâ€™s tourist accommodations which started in mid-2014. He added that holiday homes see demand from Europeans.
The holiday homes market is regulated by Dubai Tourism.
